variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

dependencies.name: py-alabaster
dependencies.description:
Alabaster is a visually (c)lean, responsive, configurable theme for the
Sphinx documentation system.

dependencies.name: py-babel
dependencies.description:
Babel is an integrated collection of utilities that assist in
internationalizing and localizing Python applications, with an emphasis
on web-based applications.

dependencies.name: py-colorama
dependencies.description: Cross-platform colored terminal text.

dependencies.name: py-docutils
dependencies.description:
Docutils is an open-source text processing system for processing
plaintext documentation into useful formats, such as HTML, LaTeX, man-
pages, open-document or XML. It includes reStructuredText, the easy to
read, easy to use, what-you-see-is-what-you-get plaintext markup
language.

dependencies.name: py-flit-core
dependencies.description: Distribution-building parts of Flit.

dependencies.name: py-imagesize
dependencies.description:
Parses image file headers and returns image size. Supports PNG, JPEG,
JPEG2000, and GIF image file formats.

dependencies.name: py-importlib-metadata
dependencies.description: Read metadata from Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pygments
dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.

dependencies.name: py-requests
dependencies.description: Python HTTP for Humans.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-snowballstemmer
dependencies.description:
This package provides 29 stemmers for 28 languages generated from
Snowball algorithms.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx-rtd-theme
dependencies.description: ReadTheDocs.org theme for Sphinx.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-applehelp
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-applehelp is a sphinx extension which outputs Apple help
books.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-devhelp
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-devhelp is a sphinx extension which outputs Devhelp
document.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-htmlhelp
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-htmlhelp is a sphinx extension which outputs htmlhelp
document.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-jsmath
dependencies.description: A sphinx extension which renders display math in HTML via JavaScript.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-qthelp
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-qthelp is a sphinx extension which outputs QtHelp
document.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-serializinghtml
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-serializinghtml is a sphinx extension which outputs
"serialized" HTML files (json and pickle).

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-websupport
dependencies.description:
sphinxcontrib-webuspport provides a Python API to easily integrate
Sphinx documentation into your Web application.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: py-pylatex
dependent_to.description: A Python library for creating LaTeX files and snippets

dependent_to.name: fenics
dependent_to.description:
FEniCS is organized as a collection of interoperable components that
together form the FEniCS Project. These components include the problem-
solving environment DOLFIN, the form compiler FFC, the finite element
tabulator FIAT, the just-in-time compiler Instant / Dijitso, the code
generation interface UFC, the form language UFL and a range of
additional components.

dependent_to.name: py-graphviz
dependent_to.description: Simple Python interface for Graphviz

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-moderncmakedomain
dependent_to.description: Sphinx Domain for Modern CMake.

dependent_to.name: py-furo
dependent_to.description: A clean customisable Sphinx documentation theme..

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-issuetracker
dependent_to.description: Sphinx integration with different issuetrackers.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxautomodapi
dependent_to.description: Provides Sphinx directives to autogenerate API documentation pages

dependent_to.name: py-pydata-sphinx-theme
dependent_to.description:
A clean, three-column, Bootstrap-based Sphinx theme by and for the
PyData community.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-mermaid
dependent_to.description:
This extension allows you to embed `Mermaid
<http://knsv.github.io/mermaid/>`_ graphs in your documents, including
general flowcharts, sequence and gantt diagrams.

dependent_to.name: py-qtconsole
dependent_to.description: Jupyter Qt console

dependent_to.name: py-coapthon3
dependent_to.description:
CoAPthon3 is a porting to python3 of my CoAPthon library. CoAPthon3 is a
python3 library to the CoAP protocol compliant with the RFC. Branch is
available for the Twisted framework.

dependent_to.name: varnish-cache
dependent_to.description: This is Varnish Cache, the high-performance HTTP accelerator.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-rtd-theme
dependent_to.description: ReadTheDocs.org theme for Sphinx.

dependent_to.name: vigra
dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-book-theme
dependent_to.description:
Lightweight Sphinx theme designed to mimic the look-and-feel of an
interactive book.

dependent_to.name: py-recommonmark
dependent_to.description:
A docutils-compatibility bridge to CommonMark. This allows you to write
CommonMark inside of Docutils & Sphinx projects. Documentation is
available on Read the Docs: http://recommonmark.readthedocs.org

dependent_to.name: py-pytorch-sphinx-theme
dependent_to.description: PyTorch Sphinx Theme.

dependent_to.name: flecsi
dependent_to.description:
FleCSI is a compile-time configurable framework designed to support
multi-physics application development. As such, FleCSI attempts to
provide a very general set of infrastructure design patterns that can be
specialized and extended to suit the needs of a broad variety of solver
and data requirements. Current support includes multi-dimensional mesh
topology, mesh geometry, and mesh adjacency information.

dependent_to.name: spack
dependent_to.description:
Spack is a multi-platform package manager that builds and installs
multiple versions and configurations of software. It works on Linux,
macOS, and many supercomputers. Spack is non-destructive: installing a
new version of a package does not break existing installations, so many
configurations of the same package can coexist.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-bibtex
dependent_to.description: A Sphinx extension for BibTeX style citations.

dependent_to.name: lvarray
dependent_to.description: LvArray portable HPC containers.

dependent_to.name: py-pyside2
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for Qt.

dependent_to.name: flibcpp
dependent_to.description: Fortran bindings to the C++ Standard Library.

dependent_to.name: py-pyside
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for Qt.

dependent_to.name: py-uncertainties
dependent_to.description:
Transparent calculations with uncertainties on the quantities involved
(aka error propagation); fast calculation of derivatives

dependent_to.name: py-repoze-lru
dependent_to.description: A tiny LRU cache implementation and decorator

dependent_to.name: arbor
dependent_to.description:
Arbor is a high-performance library for computational neuroscience
simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-argparse
dependent_to.description: Sphinx extension to automatically document argparse-based commands.

dependent_to.name: py-pydotplus
dependent_to.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot language

dependent_to.name: py-autodocsumm
dependent_to.description: Extended sphinx autodoc including automatic autosummaries.

dependent_to.name: py-nbsphinx
dependent_to.description:
nbsphinx is a Sphinx extension that provides a source parser for *.ipynb
files.

dependent_to.name: py-breathe
dependent_to.description:
This is an extension to reStructuredText and Sphinx to be able to read
and render the Doxygen xml output.

dependent_to.name: environment-modules
dependent_to.description:
The Environment Modules package provides for the dynamic modification of
a user's environment via module files.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-copybutton
dependent_to.description: A small sphinx extension to add a "copy" button to code blocks.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-jquery
dependent_to.description: A sphinx extension which ensure that jQuery is installed with Sphinx.

dependent_to.name: reframe
dependent_to.description:
ReFrame is a framework for writing regression tests for HPC systems. The
goal of this framework is to abstract away the complexity of the
interactions with the system, separating the logic of a regression test
from the low-level details, which pertain to the system configuration
and setup. This allows users to write easily portable regression tests,
focusing only on the functionality.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-programoutput
dependent_to.description:
A Sphinx extension to literally insert the output of arbitrary commands
into documents, helping you to keep your command examples up to date.

dependent_to.name: conduit
dependent_to.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.

dependent_to.name: variorum
dependent_to.description:
Variorum is a library providing vendor-neutral interfaces for monitoring
and controlling underlying hardware features.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-immaterial
dependent_to.description:
An adaptation of the popular mkdocs-material theme for the Sphinx
documentation tool.

dependent_to.name: py-trojanzoo-sphinx-theme
dependent_to.description: TrojanZoo Sphinx Theme

dependent_to.name: fio
dependent_to.description:
Flexible I/O Tester. Fio spawns a number of threads or processes doing a
particular type of I/O action as specified by the user. fio takes a
number of global parameters, each inherited by the thread unless
otherwise parameters given to them overriding that setting is given.

dependent_to.name: ascent
dependent_to.description:
Ascent is an open source many-core capable lightweight in situ
visualization and analysis infrastructure for multi-physics HPC
simulations.

dependent_to.name: yade
dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinxcontrib-trio
dependent_to.description:
This sphinx extension helps you document Python code that uses
async/await, or abstract methods, or context managers, or generators, or
... you get the idea.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-tabs
dependent_to.description: Create tabbed content in Sphinx documentation when building HTML.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-espressopp
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-gallery
dependent_to.description:
A `Sphinx` extension that builds an HTML version of any Python script
and puts it into an examples gallery.

dependent_to.name: py-numpydoc
dependent_to.description: numpydoc - Numpy's Sphinx extensions

dependent_to.name: portcullis
dependent_to.description: PORTable CULLing of Invalid Splice junctions

dependent_to.name: py-dask-ml
dependent_to.description: Scalable Machine Learning with Dask.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-hieroglyph
dependent_to.description:
Hieroglyph is an extension for Sphinx which builds HTML presentations
from ReStructured Text documents.

dependent_to.name: axom
dependent_to.description:
Axom provides a robust, flexible software infrastructure for the
development of multi-physics applications and computational tools.

dependent_to.name: botan
dependent_to.description: Crypto and TLS for Modern C++

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-multiversion
dependent_to.description: A Sphinx extension for building self-hosted versioned documentation.

dependent_to.name: py-ocp-models
dependent_to.description:
Reference implementation for the MLPerf HPC OpenCatalyst DimeNet++
benchmark

dependent_to.name: py-exhale
dependent_to.description:
Automatic C++ library api documentation generation: breathe doxygen in
and exhale it out.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-autodoc-typehints
dependent_to.description: Type hints (PEP 484) support for the Sphinx autodoc extension

dependent_to.name: fish
dependent_to.description:
fish is a smart and user-friendly command line shell for OS X, Linux,
and the rest of the family.

dependent_to.name: libabigail
dependent_to.description: The ABI Generic Analysis and Instrumentation Library

dependent_to.name: seqan
dependent_to.description:
SeqAn is an open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data
structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological
data. Our library applies a unique generic design that guarantees high
performance, generality, extensibility, and integration with other
libraries. SeqAn is easy to use and simplifies the development of new
software tools with a minimal loss of performance

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-basic-ng
dependent_to.description: A modern skeleton for Sphinx themes.

dependent_to.name: n2p2
dependent_to.description:
N2p2 (The neural network potential package) provides ready-to-use
software for high-dimensional neural network potentials in computational
physics and chemistry.

dependent_to.name: charliecloud
dependent_to.description: Lightweight user-defined software stacks for HPC.

dependent_to.name: kitty
dependent_to.description: fast, featureful, cross-platform, GPU-based terminal emulator

dependent_to.name: py-myst-parser
dependent_to.description:
A Sphinx and Docutils extension to parse MyST, a rich and extensible
flavour of Markdown for authoring technical and scientific
documentation.

dependent_to.name: py-elephant
dependent_to.description: Elephant is a package for analysis of electrophysiology data in Python

dependent_to.name: cmake
dependent_to.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependent_to.name: py-shiboken
dependent_to.description: Shiboken generates bindings for C++ libraries using CPython.

dependent_to.name: py-abcpy
dependent_to.description:
ABCpy is a highly modular, scientific library for approximate Bayesian
computation (ABC) written in Python. It is designed to run all included
ABC algorithms in parallel, either using multiple cores of a single
computer or using an Apache Spark or MPI enabled cluster.

dependent_to.name: libnetworkit
dependent_to.description:
NetworKit is a growing open-source toolkit for large-scale network
analysis. Its aim is to provide tools for the analysis of large networks
in the size range from thousands to billions of edges. For this purpose,
it implements efficient graph algorithms, many of them parallel to
utilize multicore architectures. These are meant to compute standard
measures of network analysis, such as degree sequences, clustering
coefficients, and centrality measures. In this respect, NetworKit is
comparable to packages such as NetworkX, albeit with a focus on
parallelism and scalability.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-removed-in
dependent_to.description: versionremoved and removed-in directives for Sphinx.

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-prompt
dependent_to.description: Sphinx directive to add unselectable prompt.

dependent_to.name: py-glmsingle
dependent_to.description: A toolbox for accurate single-trial estimates in fMRI time-series data.

dependent_to.name: celeritas
dependent_to.description:
Celeritas is a new Monte Carlo transport code designed for high-
performance (GPU-targeted) simulation of high-energy physics detectors.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-design
dependent_to.description:
A sphinx extension for designing beautiful, screen-size responsive web
components.
